concise_definition: n. 保释金, 保释; v. 保释, 用桶舀出, 丢弃

definitions.explanation_en: A sum of money or property deposited with a court to secure the release of a person from legal custody, ensuring their appearance at a future trial.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指为确保被拘留者出庭受审而向法院缴纳的一定金额的钱财或财产，用以换取其暂时获释。
definitions.example_en: The judge set bail at $50,000, which the defendant’s family paid immediately.
definitions.example_cn: 法官将保释金定为五万美元，被告的家人立即支付了这笔款项。

definitions.explanation_en: To secure the release of someone from jail by paying bail.
definitions.explanation_cn: 通过支付保释金使某人从监狱获释。
definitions.example_en: They bailed their son out of jail after he was arrested for drunk driving.
definitions.example_cn: 他们儿子因酒后驾车被捕后，他们支付了保释金将他保释出来。

definitions.explanation_en: To remove water from a boat or other vessel using a container, especially to prevent sinking.
definitions.explanation_cn: 用桶或其他容器从船或其他船只中舀出水，以防止沉没。
definitions.example_en: The crew had to bail water out of the boat during the storm.
definitions.example_cn: 风暴中，船员们不得不把船里的水舀出去。

definitions.explanation_en: To abandon a person, responsibility, or situation, especially at a critical moment; often used informally.
definitions.explanation_cn: 在关键时刻抛弃某人、责任或处境，常用于非正式语境。
definitions.example_en: When things got tough, he bailed on his partners and left the business.
definitions.example_cn: 当事情变得艰难时，他抛弃了合伙人，离开了生意。

comparison.analysis: “Bond”（保释担保）在法律语境中常与 “bail” 互换，但 “bond” 更强调一种担保协议，通常由专业保释公司提供，而 “bail” 更泛指保释金本身或保释行为。在口语中，人们常说 “post bail”，但不说 “post bond” 作为动词。
“Dump”（丢弃）与 “bail” 在表示“抛弃”时语义相近，但 “dump” 更强调粗暴、无情地抛弃，常用于人际关系或物品；而 “bail” 更侧重于在压力或困难时刻临阵脱逃，带有临时性或逃避责任的意味，语气较轻。
“Scoop”（舀取）与 “bail” 在“舀水”义项上相似，但 “scoop” 通常指用勺状工具快速取物，不特指排水防沉；而 “bail” 专指为防止沉没而持续舀水，具有明确的应急目的，语义更专业、更具体。
